Class Instrument

  • java.lang.Object
    • codeandchords.Instrument

  • public class Instrument
extends java.lang.Object
    06/12/2017 Class to play Notes; usually called by a Melody. <<<<<<< HEAD
    Author:

      void pauseNote(boolean pause)
      Pauses or un-pauses the Instrument by passing this.wavePlayer, this.frequencyGlide and this.gainEnvelope to either a PauseTrigger or StartTrigger.
      void playNote(Note note)
      Sets the attack, decay, sustain, and release envelopes, then either pauses the WavePlayer (for rests) or sets it to the frequency of the given Note.

      Sets the adsr with pre-determined values designated by the given preset number.

      void stopNote()

    • Method Detail

      • playNote

        public void playNote(Note note)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sets the attack, decay, sustain, and release envelopes, then either pauses the WavePlayer (for rests) or sets it to the frequency of the given Note.
        Parameters:
        note - Note whose midiNote is turned into a frequency and used to play it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • stopNote

        public void stopNote()
        Stops the playing Note by clearing this.gainEnvelope and pausing this.wavePlayer.

      • pauseNote

        public void pauseNote(boolean pause)
        Pauses or un-pauses the Instrument by passing this.wavePlayer, this.frequencyGlide and this.gainEnvelope to either a PauseTrigger or StartTrigger.
        Parameters:
        pause - boolean indicating whether to pause or un-pause the Instrument

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float vol)
        Setter for the volumeGlide instance variable
        Parameters:
        vol - float to which this.volumeGlide will be set (TODO - what is the range?)

      • setADSR

        public void setADSR(int presetNum)
        Sets the adsr with pre-determined values designated by the given preset number.
        Parameters:
        presetNum - int designating the preset values to which adsr is to be set
